skill.name: codebase-analysis
skill.description: Patterns and techniques for analyzing brownfield codebases. Use when onboarding to unfamiliar code, preparing for refactoring, conducting architecture reviews, or identifying technical debt.
skill.summary: Patterns and techniques for analyzing brownfield codebases. Use when onboarding to unfamiliar code, ...
skill.author: Consiliency

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no code execution capabilities. Contains only documentation and workflow instructions for AI-assisted code analysis. Uses standard read-only shell commands (grep, ls, cat) for exploring codebase structure.

content.value_statement: Understanding unfamiliar codebases takes too long. This skill provides structured workflows for entry point discovery, dependency mapping, pattern detection, and technical debt identification across any technology stack.
actual_capabilities: Discovers entry points by language and framework
Traces module dependencies and import chains
Identifies architectural patterns (MVC, Layered, Hexagonal, CQRS)
Finds technical debt (TODOs, circular deps, god classes)
Classifies issues by severity (Critical, High, Medium, Low)
limitations: Does not modify code or dependencies
Requires the AI agent to execute shell commands in the target project
Analysis depth limited by time budget (quick/standard/deep)
Does not run security scanners or linters directly

use_cases.title: Onboard to new projects
use_cases.description: Quickly understand project structure, entry points, and architecture before writing code.

use_cases.title: Conduct architecture reviews
use_cases.description: Assess code quality, identify patterns, and document architectural decisions.

use_cases.title: Plan refactoring work
use_cases.description: Map dependencies, identify coupling issues, and prioritize technical debt remediation.

prompt_templates.title: Quick overview
prompt_templates.prompt: Use codebase-analysis skill to give me a quick overview of this project. Include entry points, main framework, and basic architecture.

prompt_templates.title: Dependency map
prompt_templates.prompt: Trace all dependencies starting from the main entry point. Show me the dependency graph and identify any circular dependencies.

prompt_templates.title: Debt assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a full technical debt assessment. List all TODOs, FIXME, HACK comments. Identify god classes, files without tests, and outdated dependencies.

prompt_templates.title: Architecture analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Do a deep analysis: identify the architectural pattern, verify layer boundaries, detect anti-patterns, and generate C4 diagrams for the system.

output_examples.input: Analyze this codebase structure and dependencies
output:
## Overview
- Size: 150 files, 12000 lines
- Primary Language: TypeScript
- Framework: NestJS
- Architecture: Modular + DI

## Entry Points
- src/main.ts - Bootstrap
- src/app.module.ts - Root module

## Technical Debt
- 3 High priority issues
- 12 Medium priority issues
- God class: UserService.ts (650 lines)

best_practices: Start with entry points before exploring random files
Trace dependencies before making architectural claims
Classify technical debt by severity to prioritize fixes
Document findings as you go using the standard report format
anti_patterns: Analyzing random files without finding entry points first
Making architectural claims without tracing dependencies
Skipping pattern detection before identifying anti-patterns
Reporting technical debt without severity classification

faq.question: What languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, Go, Java, Rust, C, C++, Ruby, Dart, and Flutter with patterns for 15+ frameworks.

faq.question: How long does analysis take?
faq.answer: Three analysis depths available: quick (5min), standard (30min), and deep (1hr+) depending on project size.

faq.question: Can this modify my codebase?
faq.answer: No. This skill only reads and analyzes code. It does not write files, run tests, or modify dependencies.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill that guides AI agents. All code stays on your machine and is never sent externally.

faq.question: Why are shell commands shown?
faq.answer: Commands like grep and ls are examples for AI agents. The AI executes them in your project to gather information safely.

faq.question: How is this different from static analysis tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides workflow guidance and pattern recognition. It complements tools like madge, jscpd, or eslint rather than replacing them.
